commits.message:
Merge pull request #3545 from eviljeff/stop-abuse-emails

Removes the email functionality when an abuse report is submitted.
fix failing test that was checking for email
Removes the email functionality when an abuse report is submitted.

Merge pull request #3546 from diox/add-swig

Add swig to travis builds to prevent weird failures
Add swig to travis builds to prevent weird failures

Merge pull request #3544 from mozilla/django-1.8.18

Update django to 1.8.18
Update django to 1.8.18

Merge pull request #3540 from diox/so-long-and-thanks-for-all-the-fish

Adjust submission closed wording
Adjust submission closed wording

Merge pull request #3539 from diox/remove-iarc-server-side-interaction

Remove IARC server interaction

Remove IARC server interaction

To make things coherent this also removes the need for new apps to have
content ratings set at submission time, even though submission has been
disabled in bug 1299568.

Displaying cert and ratings is left for apps that already had it set,
but developers can't change it anymore.

Merge pull request #3537 from diox/remove-iarc-waffle

 Remove old IARC implementation

Merge pull request #3538 from diox/only-admins-can-submit-updates

Remove links to submit new versions of apps for non-admins (bug 1299565)

Merge pull request #3536 from diox/close-app-submissions

Remove links to submit new apps to Marketplace (bug 1299561)
Remove old IARC implementation
Remove links to submit new versions of apps for non-admins (bug 1299565)
Remove links to submit new apps to Marketplace (bug 1299561)
Update IARC descriptor texts
Remove broken test

Merge pull request #3543 from jasonthomas/remove-solitude-healthcheck

Remove solitude reference from view and template
Remove solitude reference from view and template
Remove solitude auth check from monitor Bug 1311724

Merge pull request #3542 from jasonthomas/remove-solitude-healthcheck

Remove solitude auth check from monitor Bug 1311724
Extract/compile script.  Today's lucky number is 20999.

Merge pull request #3541 from kroustou/fix_1188678

Remove header .logo fixed width in order make rtl work properly

Remove header .logo fixed width in order make rtl work properly

This is a fix for the bug 1188678

Pontoon: Update Greek (el) localization of Marketplace

Localization authors:
- Alfredos-Panagiotis Damkalis <fredy@fredy.gr>

Pontoon: Update Persian (fa) localization of Marketplace

Localization authors:
- reza.habibi2008 <reza.habibi2008@gmail.com>

Pontoon: Update Indonesian (id) localization of Marketplace

Localization authors:
- alamanda <dian.ina@gmail.com>

issue_comments.body: I'd suggest adding a line to amo.views.monitor to ensure that the apps.json file exists and is readable (it's just a 1 line addition)

commit_comments.body: Wouldn't it make sense to put these examples under /docs/?
The "for" on line 32 should be on 31 before "normal."

issue_comments.body:
r+

are you not changing the message to an error when the number gets low any more?
Thanks; here are some fixes: https://github.com/kumar303/zamboni/commit/8eb4770a94e35195dcce9d79f7b5c3aa09fc12ac  Does this look right?
r+ looks good to me.  +1 for feature flags!
Looks good to me- but I just read through it.
withdrawing this request - saw the log for a specific add-on... didn't look pretty.

r? kumar - I reused the same branch, so we can use the same pull request :)

This is the separate log page I was talking about.  Try it out.

FYI Paul, you can change your commit message by doing

git commit --amend
I like how my face is plastered everywhere on this page.

commit_comments.body: Do you prefer using the md5 algo and in fact our own methods for creating a password over those in d.c.auth.models.User?  It looks like yours will do basically the same thing, auth.User uses sha1 by default.
This deprecates, IMO, the use of the ACL for setting superuser... I'm fine with that.  We should probably document this.
why didn't I think of this... I kept having to look this up :)

Add 

export FORCE_DB='plz'

to build.sh, since hudson should recreate each time.
+1 namedtuples
Do these not have proper urls?
r+
We should move this to a nick.css maybe.
I started using settings.STATIC_URL, and left settings.MEDIA_URL for potentially user-uploaded stuff which we may not ever use.
settings.PRODUCT_MANAGER
:1,$s/MEDIA_/STATIC_/g
I see what you did there... I like it.
remove me too
I like that these are all en-US, because for en speakers this will make easy to read URLs, and for everyone else they can learn english via URLs

issue_comments.body: Committed with some style changes in https://github.com/jbalogh/zamboni/commit/cb68ebf

commit_comments.body: This is wrong.  User here is the django.contrib.auth.User model, which none of our tables will link to.  Isn't that lame?
I don't think CompatReport belongs in here.  That app doesn't show up in /addon(s) anywhere; it will have separate views and even a little API.
I just use ctrl+p in the shell to find it again, but I'm adding it here so we can use it for `git bisect run`.
I considered that, but I thought it might be easier to find example settings under the root.  But now that I'm giving a link in the docs, I guess it doesn't matter where they are.
If you're gonna pylint, I'm gonna pep8.  A continued indentation should line up with the opening paren.
No backslash needed.
Like I said, continued indentation should line up with the first line.
Not at the moment.  I'm doing the browse pages for 5.7, so I'll get these all reverse'd then.
I didn't realize that wasn't happening already.  Good catch.
That's the plan.  But then you guys can't review what's going on, since those commits go in a separate repo, so I left it all inline until it's time to commit.

issue_comments.body:
Here's how the region function ended up looking:

https://github.com/jbalogh/zamboni/pull/110/files#L6R20
Also, is there any staging step in this workflow, to show people like engagement?
k. I also didn't mean to include the product-details commit; that's already been done in master. also, tests need to be written.

commit_comments.body: _like_
This related_name should be "reviews". I'll fix it.

btw: if you use start off with `self.all()` here instead of `get_query_set()`, you'll be able to narrow down "incoming" query sets, so that myuser.addons.featured() will exactly return what you think it should. I'll change that and add a test.

review_comments.body: Django has a nice shortcut for this: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/http/shortcuts/#redirect
I'm curious why hash this and not just use the plain key string for the cache?
If you want to be picky about the XML output here, you can use `-%}` so the template engine will strip newlines.  See: http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/templates/#whitespace-control

The `license_url()` vs `lincense.url` was confusing to me on first read. It looks good... if there isn't a license url, we provide a link to the addons site for the license text, otherwise we show the URL provided.
For PEP8, keep a newline between functions.
For PEP8, this should have a space before the `1`.
I notice this has lost the `abbr` tag. This might be ok, but I thought I'd ask. Since hovering the label shows the tooltip now (right?) I'd imagine this is fine.
It's right there. So yeah, probably not a big deal. :)

This one isn't going to work since the `id` here is the ID for the `RereviewQueue` table. You'll need `.exclude(addon__in=excluded_ids`.

Also, a test would be good. You could probably add the tabnav pyquery tests above this one, to this test:
https://github.com/mozilla/zamboni/blob/master/mkt/reviewers/tests/test_views.py#L254
This one and the test above it are exactly the same?
Can you do `do_raise = getattr(settings, 'RAISE_ON_SIGNAL_ERROR', False)`? Seems cleaner, and also defaults to `False`.
I think you should do `from django.conf import settings`.
Looks like the `SuspiciousOperation` import here is now unused.
Ah, so get_es stashes a copy of the es it generates.
does `uncached` automatically do `no_transforms`?
This is marketplace CSS... is that needed to fix AMO?
Ok. I just didn't see any template changes or anything else on mkt so it seemed out of place. If this change is fine there all looks good to me.
You missed your chance to rick roll jenkins
should this be `dest`?
You should use `u` on the concatenated strings as well.
Is there value in having a title attribute if it's the same as the link text? Is that for accessibility?
What, no Harvard comma?  :-1:
"advanced"
you don't count the html or css?
you spelled "Stimulator" wrong.
more than 80 chars
There's `check_review_delete` already that's available to the templates. Do you need to make this?
I wouldn't mind seeing a before and after for this count to show they're the same.
Totally not DRY

An alternative way to do this is:

```
try:
    addon = Addon.objects.get(pk=addon_id)
except Addon.DoesNotExist:
    return
```

This also keeps it to a single db query, whereas the `exists` and the `[0]` actually does 2 separate queries.

issue_comments.body: I'd suggest adding a line to amo.views.monitor to ensure that the apps.json file exists and is readable (it's just a 1 line addition)

r+

are you not changing the message to an error when the number gets low any more?
Thanks; here are some fixes: https://github.com/kumar303/zamboni/commit/8eb4770a94e35195dcce9d79f7b5c3aa09fc12ac  Does this look right?
r+ looks good to me.  +1 for feature flags!
Looks good to me- but I just read through it.
withdrawing this request - saw the log for a specific add-on... didn't look pretty.

r? kumar - I reused the same branch, so we can use the same pull request :)

This is the separate log page I was talking about.  Try it out.

FYI Paul, you can change your commit message by doing

git commit --amend
I like how my face is plastered everywhere on this page.
Committed with some style changes in https://github.com/jbalogh/zamboni/commit/cb68ebf

Here's how the region function ended up looking:

https://github.com/jbalogh/zamboni/pull/110/files#L6R20
Also, is there any staging step in this workflow, to show people like engagement?
k. I also didn't mean to include the product-details commit; that's already been done in master. also, tests need to be written.

review_comments.body: Django has a nice shortcut for this: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/http/shortcuts/#redirect
I'm curious why hash this and not just use the plain key string for the cache?
If you want to be picky about the XML output here, you can use `-%}` so the template engine will strip newlines.  See: http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/templates/#whitespace-control

The `license_url()` vs `lincense.url` was confusing to me on first read. It looks good... if there isn't a license url, we provide a link to the addons site for the license text, otherwise we show the URL provided.
For PEP8, keep a newline between functions.
For PEP8, this should have a space before the `1`.
I notice this has lost the `abbr` tag. This might be ok, but I thought I'd ask. Since hovering the label shows the tooltip now (right?) I'd imagine this is fine.
It's right there. So yeah, probably not a big deal. :)

This one isn't going to work since the `id` here is the ID for the `RereviewQueue` table. You'll need `.exclude(addon__in=excluded_ids`.

Also, a test would be good. You could probably add the tabnav pyquery tests above this one, to this test:
https://github.com/mozilla/zamboni/blob/master/mkt/reviewers/tests/test_views.py#L254
This one and the test above it are exactly the same?
Can you do `do_raise = getattr(settings, 'RAISE_ON_SIGNAL_ERROR', False)`? Seems cleaner, and also defaults to `False`.
I think you should do `from django.conf import settings`.
Looks like the `SuspiciousOperation` import here is now unused.
Ah, so get_es stashes a copy of the es it generates.
does `uncached` automatically do `no_transforms`?
This is marketplace CSS... is that needed to fix AMO?
Ok. I just didn't see any template changes or anything else on mkt so it seemed out of place. If this change is fine there all looks good to me.
You missed your chance to rick roll jenkins
should this be `dest`?
You should use `u` on the concatenated strings as well.
Is there value in having a title attribute if it's the same as the link text? Is that for accessibility?
What, no Harvard comma?  :-1:
"advanced"
you don't count the html or css?
you spelled "Stimulator" wrong.
more than 80 chars
There's `check_review_delete` already that's available to the templates. Do you need to make this?
I wouldn't mind seeing a before and after for this count to show they're the same.
Totally not DRY

An alternative way to do this is:

```
try:
    addon = Addon.objects.get(pk=addon_id)
except Addon.DoesNotExist:
    return
```

This also keeps it to a single db query, whereas the `exists` and the `[0]` actually does 2 separate queries.

To make things coherent this also removes the need for new apps to have
content ratings set at submission time, even though submission has been
disabled in bug 1299568.

Displaying cert and ratings is left for apps that already had it set,
but developers can't change it anymore.

r+

are you not changing the message to an error when the number gets low any more?

commit_comments.body: Do you prefer using the md5 algo and in fact our own methods for creating a password over those in d.c.auth.models.User?  It looks like yours will do basically the same thing, auth.User uses sha1 by default.
This deprecates, IMO, the use of the ACL for setting superuser... I'm fine with that.  We should probably document this.
why didn't I think of this... I kept having to look this up :)

Add 

export FORCE_DB='plz'

to build.sh, since hudson should recreate each time.
+1 namedtuples
Do these not have proper urls?
r+
We should move this to a nick.css maybe.
I started using settings.STATIC_URL, and left settings.MEDIA_URL for potentially user-uploaded stuff which we may not ever use.
settings.PRODUCT_MANAGER
:1,$s/MEDIA_/STATIC_/g
I see what you did there... I like it.
remove me too
I like that these are all en-US, because for en speakers this will make easy to read URLs, and for everyone else they can learn english via URLs

issue_comments.body: Committed with some style changes in https://github.com/jbalogh/zamboni/commit/cb68ebf

commit_comments.body: This is wrong.  User here is the django.contrib.auth.User model, which none of our tables will link to.  Isn't that lame?
I don't think CompatReport belongs in here.  That app doesn't show up in /addon(s) anywhere; it will have separate views and even a little API.
I just use ctrl+p in the shell to find it again, but I'm adding it here so we can use it for `git bisect run`.
I considered that, but I thought it might be easier to find example settings under the root.  But now that I'm giving a link in the docs, I guess it doesn't matter where they are.
If you're gonna pylint, I'm gonna pep8.  A continued indentation should line up with the opening paren.
No backslash needed.
Like I said, continued indentation should line up with the first line.
Not at the moment.  I'm doing the browse pages for 5.7, so I'll get these all reverse'd then.
I didn't realize that wasn't happening already.  Good catch.
That's the plan.  But then you guys can't review what's going on, since those commits go in a separate repo, so I left it all inline until it's time to commit.

btw: if you use start off with `self.all()` here instead of `get_query_set()`, you'll be able to narrow down "incoming" query sets, so that myuser.addons.featured() will exactly return what you think it should. I'll change that and add a test.
